hints_html:
Try finding the level curve when z = e by setting the equation equal to e and simplifying it to classify the curve.

To find points on the curve, choose simple values for x (and y) and calculate the corresponding value for y (and x).
hints_latex:
Try finding the level curve when \emph{z} = \emph{e} by setting the
equation equal to \emph{e} and simplifying it to classify the curve.

To find points on the curve, choose simple values for \emph{x} (and
\emph{y}) and calculate the corresponding value for \emph{y} (and
\emph{x}).
hints_raw:
Try finding the level curve when ''z'' = ''e'' by setting the equation equal to ''e'' and simplifying it to classify the curve.

To find points on the curve, choose simple values for ''x'' (and ''y'') and calculate the corresponding value for ''y'' (and ''x'').
question: 8 (d)
sols_html:
If \(z = e\) then

\(e = e^{x^2 + 4y^2}\) and by taking the logarithm of both sides:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 1 = x^2 + 4y^2\end{aligned}\]

This is an ellipse.

The four easiest points are the intercepts.

If \(x=0\) then \(4y^2 = 1\) and \(y = \pm 1/2\) are the y-intercepts. If \(y=0\) then \(x^2 = 1\) and \(x= \pm 1\) are the x-intercepts. The sketch is below:
sols_raw:
If <math>z = e</math> then

<math>e = e^{x^2 + 4y^2}</math> and by taking the logarithm of both sides:

:<math>\displaystyle
1 = x^2 + 4y^2</math>

This is <b>an ellipse</b>.

The four easiest points are the intercepts. 

If <math>x=0</math> then <math>4y^2 = 1</math> and <math>y = \pm 1/2</math> are the y-intercepts. If <math>y=0</math> then <math>x^2 = 1</math> and <math>x= \pm 1</math> are the x-intercepts. The sketch is below:

:[[File:Ellipse2012.png|400px|The level curve <math>x^2 + 4y^2 = 1</math>.]]
statement_html:
Short-answer questions. No credit will be given for the answer (even if it is correct) without the accompanying work.

Identify and sketch the level curve corresponding to z = e of the function

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle z = e^{x^2+4y^2}\end{aligned}\]

Label the axes of your graph and plot the coordinates of at least four points on the level curve.

Also, answer the following: The curve is a

  1. parabola

  2. ellipse

  3. circle

  4. hyperbola
statement_latex:
\emph{Short-answer questions. No credit will be given for the answer
(even if it is correct) without the accompanying work.}

Identify and sketch the level curve corresponding to \emph{z = e} of the
function

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle
z = e^{x^2+4y^2}
\end{align*}

Label the axes of your graph and plot the coordinates of at least four
points on the level curve.

Also, answer the following: The curve is a

\begin{enumerate}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  parabola
\item
  ellipse
\item
  circle
\item
  hyperbola
\end{enumerate}
statement_raw:
''Short-answer questions. No credit will be given for the answer (even if it is correct) without the accompanying work.''

Identify and sketch the level curve corresponding to ''z = e'' of the function

:<math> \displaystyle
z = e^{x^2+4y^2}
</math>

Label the axes of your graph and plot the coordinates of at least four points on the level curve.

Also, answer the following: The curve is a
# parabola
# ellipse
# circle
# hyperbola
